result.execSummary:
The defendant Melanie R. Casper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
++Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.  May Not have contact with Brian & Mary S or Heather S unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State, by zoom. No appearance by the Defendant. Clerk/H. Barnett. Court reporter by zoom. Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing is being held via video conferencing. Issue of outstanding restitution and court obligations. DOC Agt Charlie Sosinski appeared by zoom. Court finds that the deft's address was not provided to the court. Court orders probation extended for 1 year for failure to pay any restitution. Agt Sosinski to submit order and notify IL.

Probation review hearing on October 2, 2020 at 11:00 am. Any person entering a courtroom is required to wear a mask.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  DE appeared with Atty Benjamin Schwartz.  Clerk K. Zirbel.   Total length of sentence: 3 years.  Initial term of confinement: one year WSP.  Term of extended supervision: 2 years.  SENTENCE IS STAYED.  Def. placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions.  Conditions of probation include no contact with Brian S., Mary S., and Heather S.  Probation is concurrent with sentence in 16CF643.  Pay costs and DNA surcharge.  Parties stipulate to payment of restitution of $3,379.41.
